Q: Why does the cellphone get sizzling when it is charging?

A: This is regular, as a result of the cellphone will generate some warmth when it’s charging. However, the primary causes for the warmth are as follows:

1. The charging velocity will probably be sooner when the cellphone energy is low, the wall charger will output 9V excessive voltage, and the cellphone will generate warmth due to the voltage changing course of.

2. Don’t play the cellphone whereas the cellphone is charged with low energy, in any other case the cellphone will probably be in a excessive load state.

About the error message “This accessory may not be supported by device”:

The message would seem for those who had been utilizing a non-Apple wall charger or in poor contact, however even in case you are utilizing an Apple accent, the error may occur for the firmware drawback with iOS.
